newsitem.title: HONG KONG: EC's Brittan to visit Hong Kong in mid-November.
newsitem.headline: EC's Brittan to visit Hong Kong in mid-November.

text.p: Sir Leon Brittan, vice president of the European Commission (EC), plans to visit Hong Kong next week to address the World Economic Forum, the EC office in Hong Kong said on Monday.

Brittan, who is in charge of external relations and trade policy for the EC, will also meet Governor Chris Patten, Chief Secretary Anson Chan and Financial Secretary Donald Tsang during the November 17-19 visit, the office said in a news release.
It said Brittan would discuss future links between the European Union and the British colony, which is due to be handed back to China on June 30, 1997.
The Swiss-based World Economic Forum of business and political leaders meet to discuss global economic trends.
